action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
X ▢ ▢ X ▢
X X X ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ X ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X

DESCRIPTION: My grid is a 5x5 square. Starting from the top left corner and going row by row: the first row has an X in the first and last positions; the second row has an X in the first and fourth positions; the third row has three Xs in the first, second, and third positions; the fourth row has an X in the first and fourth positions; the fifth row has an X in the first and last positions. All other positions are blank.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
▢ X ▢ ▢ X
▢ ▢ X X X
▢ X ▢ ▢ X
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X

DESCRIPTION: My grid is a 5x5 matrix with X's and blank squares. The X's form a diagonal line from the top left to the bottom right corner, with an additional X at the end of the third row, making two adjacent X's in that row. There are also X's in the corners of the grid. The rest of the squares are blank.

This is my DESCRIPTION: My grid is a 5x5 square. Starting from the top left corner and going row by row: the first row has an X in the first and last positions; the second row has an X in the first and fourth positions; the third row has three Xs in the first, second, and third positions; the fourth row has an X in the first and fourth positions; the fifth row has an X in the first and last positions. All other positions are blank.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In your grid, is there an X in the third position of the fourth row?

This is my DESCRIPTION: My grid is a 5x5 matrix with X's and blank squares. The X's form a diagonal line from the top left to the bottom right corner, with an additional X at the end of the third row, making two adjacent X's in that row. There are also X's in the corners of the grid. The rest of the squares are blank.
QUESTION: In your grid, is there an X in the third position of the fourth row? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there an X in the second position of the second row in your grid?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Is there an X in the second position of the second row in your grid? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.

ANSWER: No.
